qas.question: What is the Afrikaans name for Namibia?
How far away is Namibia to the Zambezi River?
When did Namibia gain independence from South Africa?
What is the French word for the Republic of Namibia?
With what country does Namibia share most of its northern border with?
On what date did the Namibian War of Independence start?
What type of border does Namibia share with Angola?

context: Namibia (i/nəˈmɪbiə/, /næˈ-/), officially the Republic of Namibia (German:  Republik Namibia (help·info); Afrikaans: <b5_0>Republiek van <a0_0>Namibië<b5_0/><a0_0/>) is a country in <a1_0>southern<a1_0/> Africa whose western border is the <a2_0>Atlantic Ocean<a2_0/>. It shares land borders with Zambia and <b6_0>Angola<b6_0/> to the north, Botswana to the east and South Africa to the south and east. Although it does not border Zimbabwe, a part of less than <a3_0>200 metres<a3_0/> of the Zambezi River (essentially a small bulge in Botswana to achieve a Botswana/Zambia <b8_0>micro-border<b8_0/>) separates it from that country. Namibia gained independence from South Africa on <a4_0><b7_0>21 March 1990<b7_0/><a4_0/>, following the Namibian War of Independence. Its capital and largest city is Windhoek, and it is a member state of the United Nations (UN), the Southern African Development Community (SADC), the African Union (AU), and the Commonwealth of Nations.
